required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Characterize the Abuse Liability of ALO-02 in Healthy, Non-Dependent, Recreational Opioid Abusers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Double-dummy, Placebo Controlled, Single-Dose, 6-Way Crossover Study to Determine the Relative Abuse Potential of ALO-02 (Oxycodone Hydrochloride and Naltrexone Hydrochloride Extended-Release Capsules) Compared to Oxycodone Immediate Release and Placebo When Administered Orally to Non-Dependent, Recreational Opioid Users

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to determine if oxycodone and naltrexone combination capsules (ALO-02) have the potential to be abused.

primary_outcome.measure: Drug Liking: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-2 Hours
primary_outcome.description: Drug liking assesses the degree that a participant likes a drug effect at the time the question is being asked (that is, at the moment). It is scored using a 100-point bipolar visual analogue scale (VAS) anchored in the center with a neutral anchor of

High visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

Drug liking assesses the degree that a participant likes a drug effect at the time the question is being asked (that is, at the moment). It is scored using a 100-point bipolar VAS anchored in the center with a neutral anchor of

primary_outcome.measure: High: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-2 Hours
primary_outcome.description: High VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100 point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). AUE (0-2) = Area under the effect versus time curve from time zero to time of last quantifiable effect (0-2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of oxymorphone
Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of noroxycodone
Bad Drug Effects: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Bad Drug Effects visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Nausea: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Nausea visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Feel Sick: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Feel Sick visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleepy: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Sleepy visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Dizzy: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Dizzy visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pupillometry: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Pupillometry assessments measured change in pupil size (miosis) as an indicator of opioid pharmacological properties. The same eye for each participant was used for all measurements during the study. Participants had the size of their pupil measured (in mm) using a pupillometer. Measurements were made in a dimly lit (mesopic) room with controlled lighting conditions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Good Drug Effects: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Good Drug Effects visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Any Drug Effects: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Any Drug Effects visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of oxycodone
Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of oxycodone
Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUCinf) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero extrapolated to infinity (AUCinf).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC0-1h) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC0-2h) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC0-8h) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC0-12h) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC0-24h) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of the drug over time. It is used to characterize drug absorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) for oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Drug Liking: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Drug liking assesses the degree that a participant likes a drug effect at the time the question is being asked (that is, at the moment). It is scored using a 100-point bipolar VAS anchored in the center with a neutral anchor of

secondary_outcome.measure: High: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: High VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Good Effects: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Good effects VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Any Effects: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Any effects VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100 point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bad Effects: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Bad effects VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100 point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Nausea: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Nausea VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feel Sick: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Feel sick VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100 point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleepy: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Sleepy VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100 point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dizzy: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Dizzy VAS assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100-point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). TEmax = Time to maximum observed score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pupillometry: Time to Maximum (Peak) Effect (TEmax)
secondary_outcome.description: Pupillometry assessments measured change in pupil size (miosis) as an indicator of opioid pharmacological properties. The same eye for each participant was used for all measurements during the study. Participants had the size of their pupil measured (in mm) using a pupillometer. Measurements were made in a dimly lit (mesopic) room with controlled lighting conditions. TEmax = Time to smallest post-dose pupil size.

secondary_outcome.measure: Take Drug Again: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Take Drug Again visual analogue scale (VAS) is a subjective assessment of the degree to which a participant would desire to take the drug again if given the opportunity. It is presented on a 100-point VAS with score ranging from 0 to 100 (score of 0 = definitely not; 50 = neutral; 100 = definitely so).

secondary_outcome.measure: Take Drug Again: Mean Effect (Emean)
secondary_outcome.description: Take Drug Again visual analogue scale (VAS) is a subjective assessment of the degree to which a participant would desire to take the drug again if given the opportunity. It is presented on a 100-point VAS with score ranging from 0 to 100 (score of 0 = definitely not; 50 = neutral; 100 = definitely so).

secondary_outcome.measure: Take Drug Again: Minimum Effect (Emin)
secondary_outcome.description: Take Drug Again visual analogue scale (VAS) is a subjective assessment of the degree to which a participant would desire to take the drug again if given the opportunity. It is presented on a 100-point VAS with score ranging from 0 to 100 (score of 0 = definitely not; 50 = neutral; 100 = definitely so).

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Drug Liking: Peak Effect (Emax)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Drug Liking visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the participant's global perception of drug liking (that is, effects over the whole course of the drug experience including any carryover effects). A 100-point VAS is used to assess response based on a score ranging from 0 to 100 (0 = strong disliking; 50 = neither like nor dislike; 100 = strong liking)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Drug Liking: Minimum Effect (Emin)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Drug Liking visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the participant's global perception of drug liking (that is, effects over the whole course of the drug experience including any carryover effects). A 100-point VAS is used to assess response based on a score ranging from 0 to 100 (0 = strong disliking; 50 = neither like nor dislike; 100 = strong liking)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Drug Liking: Mean Effect (Emean)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Drug Liking visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the participant's global perception of drug liking (that is, effects over the whole course of the drug experience including any carryover effects). A 100-point VAS is used to assess response based on a score ranging from 0 to 100 (0 = strong disliking; 50 = neither like nor dislike; 100 = strong liking)

secondary_outcome.description: Feel sick visual analogue scale (VAS) assesses the effect experienced by the participant on a 100 point unipolar VAS, where responses are unidirectional and range from a response of 'none' (score of 0) to 'extremely' (score of 100). AUE (0-24) = Area under the effect versus time curve from time zero to time of last quantifiable effect (0-24).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pupillometry: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-8 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: Pupillometry assessments measured change in pupil size (miosis) as an indicator of opioid pharmacological properties. The same eye for each participant was used for all measurements during the study. Participants had the size of their pupil measured (in mm) using a pupillometer. Measurements were made in a dimly lit (mesopic) room with controlled lighting conditions. AUE (0-8) = Area under the effect versus time curve from time zero to time of last quantifiable effect (0-8).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pupillometry: Area Under Effect Curve (AUE) From 0-12 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: Pupillometry assessments measured change in pupil size (miosis) as an indicator of opioid pharmacological properties. intervention.description: crushed ALO-02 60 mg/7.2 mg in solution + placebo ALO-02 (intact)
crushed oxycodone immediate-release (IR) 60 mg in solution + placebo ALO-02 (intact)
crushed ALO-02 40 mg/4.8 mg in solution + placebo ALO-02 (intact)
crushed oxycodone immediate-release (IR) 40 mg in solution + placebo ALO-02 (intact)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects.
- Non-dependent, recreational opioid users. (Must use opioid for non-therapeutic purposes on at least 10 occassions within the last year before Screening Visit, and at least once in 8 weeks before the Screening Visit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of substance and/or alcohol dependence.
- Subject has participated in, is currently participating in, or is seeking treatment for substance and/or alcohol related disorder.
- History of sleep apnea.
- Positive urine drug screen (UDS) for other that marijuana.
- Positive for Hepatitis B or C and HIV on Screening.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Relative abuse potential study; oxycodone; nalteone; Opioid-related disorders; drug abusers
